page.title: 12KEMBLE AIRFIELD
page.content: Part of Kemble airfield was in our block. We found out that it is owned by the R.A.F. though the U.S. airforce has used the base since 1983 together with the R.A.F. In one hanger the R.A.F. are repairing naval fixed wing planes (identifiable from foreign ones by transmitters). The heaviest plane that lands there is the Hercules( over 20 tons). There are 470 staff, some are civilians. They have an A10, nick named tank buster. It fires bullets the size of coke bottles which go straight into a tank shell. The fastest plane there is an F 15. They also have F 4 & F 5. They recruit British men. There are 3 fire tenders and 8 crews. They have a Dodge Mk 11. It has 8 times the foam capacity of normal fire engines and it has water as well.
